page.title: 20Med. Science HeartTransplant
page.content: Christian Barnard lived in S.Africa and pioneered heart transplant operations. Many people criticised him because for the first few years they didn't seem to work. John Haines lives in Denchworth and 3 years ago was about to die when he was given the chance to have a heart transplant at Harefield Hospital in Middlesex. His surgeon was Magdi Yacoub. Since the operation John, now 47, no longer has to sit all the time and suffer pain and breathlessness. In 1983 and 1984 he went back to Harefield hospital to raise money for other patients having heart transplants, to run in sponsored races and compete in the British Transplant Games. Back home after his operation he began to dig his garden again, then he went back to work as a kitchen fitter.
